Description: Terracotta object in form of woman's head. The head and neck of a woman, and an entity in itself, with an elaborate 'melon' hairstyle, drawn back to a large plaited bun held by an encircling band. She wears ring-shaped earrings, each pierced through to the cavity within the head; a further piercing in the hair on the upper right side is presumably an unnecessary firing-vent. The eyes are blank and there is a decided curved groove across the neck. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt with overall traces of a white dressing.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparanda. Close, probably from same mould-series: Breccia 1934: no. 282. Near: Fischer 1994: no. 1032, dated first half of second century ad; Petrie Museum uc49886.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3128)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
